author: newsdirectory3
title: Los hospitales de Jujuy dejar√°n de ser totalmente gratuitos: la provincia cre√≥ un seguro obligatorio
text:
Jujuy Passes Controversial Law Requiring Payment for Public ‚ÄãHealthcare Jujuy, argentina ‚Äì In a move that has sparked debate, the Jujuy Legislature approved‚Å§ a ‚Äålaw on December 18th establishing the Provincial Health Insurance (SEPROSA). This new system will mandate a fee‚Å§ for access‚Å¢ to public healthcare for individuals deemed by the provincial government to have‚Å§ the financial‚Å£ capacity to pay.
The law, which‚Äã has drawn criticism from some sectors, aims to‚Å§ address the financial strain on jujuy‚Äôs‚Å¢ public healthcare system. Proponents argue that requiring payment from those who can afford it will‚Äå ensure the sustainability of essential medical services for all residents.
‚ÄúThis is a‚Å£ necessary step to guarantee quality healthcare for everyone in Jujuy,‚Äù stated a spokesperson for the jujuy ‚Å§government. ‚ÄúBy implementing‚Å§ a ‚Äåfair and ‚Äçequitable system, we can ensure that our hospitals have the resources they need to provide the ‚Å¢best possible care.‚Äù
Though,‚Å¢ critics argue that the ‚Äãlaw could‚Äå create‚Äç a two-tiered healthcare system, perhaps denying access to essential medical ‚Äåcare for vulnerable populations. Concerns have also been raised ‚Äåabout the criteria‚Äã used to determine an ‚Å¢individual‚Äôs ability to pay,with fears that the system could be prone to bias and discrimination.
The implementation of SEPROSA is expected ‚Äåto‚Äå begin in the coming months. The Jujuy government has pledged to provide‚Äã clear‚Äã guidelines and clear procedures‚Äå for determining payment obligations.
This development follows a similar move by the neighboring province of Salta, which also recently implemented a fee-based‚Å£ system for public healthcare access for non-residents. The trend‚Å§ raises questions‚Äã about the future of worldwide healthcare access‚Äã in Argentina‚Äç and the potential‚Äç impact on vulnerable populations.
Jujuy Implements New Healthcare ‚ÄçFee,Sparking Debate on Access and Affordability Jujuy,Argentina ‚Äå ‚Äì A new‚Å§ healthcare fee is set to be implemented in Jujuy ‚Å¢province,sparking debate about access to medical care and the financial burden ‚Å£on‚Äå residents. The measure, ‚Äåapproved by the provincial legislature, ‚Å£will require individuals with the capacity to pay for healthcare services to contribute to a new system ‚Äãcalled SEPROSA (Sistema de Protecci√≥n Social de la Salud).
‚ÄúThose who can afford‚Äã it, considering activities like commerce, fairs,‚Äã and transportation, and ‚Äçwho are currently using the public healthcare system ‚Å£will begin paying SEPROSA,‚Äù explained Jujuy‚Äôs ‚Å¢Minister of Health,‚Äå Gustavo Bouhid. ‚ÄúThis‚Äã is a ‚Äãsolidarity-based approach, where those ‚Äåwho have more can contribute ‚Äçto the system ‚Å§and sustain it for those who have less.‚Äù
The initiative, driven by government officials, comes‚Äå amid a backdrop of reduced funding from the national government. ‚Äç ‚ÄúDue to changes in the national‚Å£ economy,provinces have stopped ‚Å£receiving the ‚Å¢funding they traditionally received,‚Äù the law‚Äôs preamble states.
Proponents of the new ‚Å¢fee argue that ‚Äçit will ensure the sustainability of Jujuy‚Äôs healthcare system and expand coverage to‚Äã include informal workers. They highlight that SEPROSA‚Äç will also cover treatments ‚Å¢at private clinics, ‚Äçeffectively extending the ‚Å¢benefits currently enjoyed by ‚Å§public sector employees.
However, the move has raised concerns‚Å¢ about affordability and potential barriers to accessing healthcare. Critics argue that the fee could disproportionately impact low- and middle-income residents, who may‚Å¢ already struggle to afford ‚Äåbasic necessities.
! Image of a‚Äã hospital ‚Å£in Jujuy
The ‚Äçimplementation of SEPROSA follows a‚Å£ recent decision to charge fees for healthcare services provided ‚Äãto foreigners in ‚ÄãJujuy. This series of‚Äç changes ‚Å¢reflects ‚Äãa broader trend of provinces grappling with funding constraints and seeking alternative revenue streams to support their healthcare‚Å§ systems.
The long-term ‚Äåimpact of SEPROSA on healthcare access and affordability in‚Äã Jujuy remains to ‚Äçbe seen. As ‚Äçthe province navigates these complex ‚Äãchallenges, the debate surrounding the new ‚Å§fee is likely ‚Äçto continue.
Jujuy Implements Controversial Healthcare Fee for Public Services JUJUY,‚Äã ARGENTINA ‚Äì A new law in Jujuy province requiring residents‚Äã to pay a ‚Å§fee for public healthcare ‚Äçservices has ‚Å¢sparked debate. The ‚ÄúSistema de Protecci√≥n Social‚Äù ‚Å£(SEPROSA) mandates a monthly payment of approximately 50,000 Argentine‚Å§ pesos, equivalent to five consultations covered by ‚Å§public employees‚Äô‚Äå health ‚Å£insurance.
Gustavo Bouhid, Jujuy‚Äôs Minister ‚Äåof Health The government argues that SEPROSA will benefit informal ‚Äãworkers who lack access to private health insurance, which‚Äç can cost upwards‚Äå of 400,000 pesos per month. They ‚Å£emphasize that the program extends coverage to private clinics and hospitals.
Though,‚Å£ the initiative has drawn‚Äå criticism. While the law ‚Äãexempts individuals‚Å¢ who ‚Å§can prove financial‚Å§ hardship, ‚Äçconcerns remain about the potential burden on low-income residents.
‚ÄúThe authority of request will establish a procedure for exemption from payment,‚Äù the law states.Those who ‚Äåpay the fee will receive a credential ‚Å£required for treatment at‚Å¢ public hospitals. Patients‚Å¢ without‚Äã the credential will still receive ‚Å¢care,but‚Äå the provincial revenue agency will pursue payment.
Emergency services‚Äå will remain accessible to all, irrespective of SEPROSA status.
The law passed ‚Äåwith support from the ruling‚Äã party and some ‚ÄçPeronist ‚Äçlegislators, while leftist lawmakers opposed the measure.‚ÄùThis is‚Å¢ an opportunity for workers in the informal‚Äå sector who don‚Äôt have the resources for private health insurance,‚Äù said‚Äã a government official. ‚ÄúSEPROSA‚Å¢ is a benefit,not a burden.‚Äù
The implementation of SEPROSA is expected to begin‚Å£ soon, with further details outlined in the program‚Äôs‚Å§ regulations.
Jujuy ‚Å§Law Sparks Debate: Should Residents Pay for Public Healthcare? Jujuy,Argentina ‚Å£ ‚Äì A new law in Jujuy‚Äã province is stirring controversy,requiring residents with higher incomes who‚Äã lack private health ‚Å¢insurance to contribute to a public healthcare fund. The legislation, championed by the ruling Peronist party, aims‚Äå to bolster the province‚Äôs public healthcare system while ensuring those‚Äç who can afford it contribute.
‚ÄúHospitals and healthcare centers that are ‚Äçpart of the‚Å§ public‚Å§ system are‚Äå not covered by this ‚Äçlaw and do not receive direct payments. We have a ‚ÄçRecovery Law in place where social security providers are billed,‚Äù explained a prominent local legislator‚Å£ and ‚Å¢physician.
He‚Å¢ emphasized that the law does not‚Äç affect ‚Äãthose without financial resources. ‚ÄúPeople who lack‚Å¢ the means continue to access healthcare‚Å§ for free,‚Äã without any payment,‚Äù he added.
The law targets ‚Äçindividuals with higher incomes who ‚Å¢are not ‚Å£enrolled in private health‚Å£ insurance.‚Äùthose individuals have the obligation to subscribe to SEPROSA if they wish to avoid ‚Äçdirect‚Å£ out-of-pocket payments and access the benefits‚Äå of the Mandatory Medical Program (PMO).‚Å£ Otherwise,‚Äç they must ‚Äãpay for services directly ‚Å¢at the time of treatment,‚Äù the legislator stated.According to the ‚Äãproposed law, approximately 400,000‚Å§ people, or ‚Äå50% of Jujuy‚Äôs population, rely on public hospitals.‚Äç Officials estimate that half ‚Å¢of these patients have the financial capacity to ‚Äãcontribute to the new fund.‚ÄùWe‚Äôre‚Äå talking‚Å£ about 50,000 pesos, while any private ‚Å§health insurance‚Å§ plan costs‚Äç a minimum of 400,000 pesos,‚Äù argued‚Å¢ Peronist deputy ‚ÄãRub√©n rivarola, who owns a important private clinic in ‚ÄçJujuy, while defending the project.
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt ‚Å£tell me they can‚Äôt afford it. We‚Äôre talking about the cost of ten sodas ‚Å§to have access to‚Äã healthcare,‚Äù he added.
The new‚Äå law has sparked heated debate, ‚Å§with some residents praising the ‚Äçinitiative as a‚Äã way to ensure the sustainability of public healthcare, while others criticize‚Å£ it as‚Äå an unfair burden‚Å§ on‚Å¢ those already struggling financially.
Jujuy‚Äôs New Healthcare Fee: An Interview with Dr. Maria Rodriguez, ‚ÄçPublic Health Expert NewsDirectory3: Today, we‚Äôre‚Äå discussing the ‚Å£controversial‚Äå new ‚Äãlaw in Jujuy province introducing a fee for public healthcare ‚Å£access. To shed light‚Äå on this complex issue, we‚Äôll be speaking with Dr. Maria ‚Å¢Rodriguez, a prominent public health expert and researcher at‚Äç the‚Å§ University of Buenos Aires. Welcome,‚Äç Dr. Rodriguez.
Dr. Rodriguez: Thank you for having me.
NewsDirectory3: Jujuy‚Äôs government argues this fee, managed by SEPROSA, is‚Äç necessary to‚Äç ensure‚Å£ sustainability of the public healthcare system. What‚Äã are your thoughts on this?
Dr. Rodriguez: While I understand the financial pressures facing Jujuy, ‚Å£implementing a user-fee system for public healthcare‚Å¢ raises meaningful ethical and practical concerns.
NewsDirectory3: could you elaborate on those concerns?
Dr.‚Äç Rodriguez: Firstly,‚Äã access to healthcare is a‚Å§ fundamental‚Å£ human right, not a commodity. Imposing fees can create a two-tiered system,‚Å£ potentially denying essential care to vulnerable ‚Å£populations.We need to ensure equitable access for all, regardless of thier‚Å¢ economic status.
NewsDirectory3: the‚Å¢ government ‚Å§claims the fee will only be levied on those with the capacity to pay. How robust is the mechanism to determine this capacity?
Dr. Rodriguez: ‚Å£ that‚Äôs a key concern. Defining ‚Äúcapacity to pay‚Äù can be subjective and open ‚Äãto bias. ‚Äå Will there be obvious ‚Äåcriteria‚Å£ and independent oversight to prevent discrimination?
NewsDirectory3: Critics also argue this could‚Å¢ push more people‚Å£ towards private healthcare, further straining the public system.
Dr. Rodriguez: ‚Å£ that‚Äôs a‚Äå valid concern. We could ‚Äçsee a vicious‚Äç cycle where the public system is further underfunded as those who can afford it opt for private care.
NewsDirectory3: ‚Å¢What alternatives could‚Äã Jujuy consider to ensure lasting healthcare without jeopardizing access?
Dr.‚Å§ Rodriguez: The government ‚Å¢could‚Äã explore avenues like increased investment in primary healthcare, preventative‚Äå medicine, and cost-efficient resource allocation. They could also advocate ‚Äãfor‚Å¢ increased funding from the national government,particularly given the economic pressures Jujuy faces.
NewsDirectory3: Dr. Rodriguez, thank you for sharing your‚Å§ valuable ‚Å¢insights on this‚Äã critical issue.
Dr.Rodriguez: My pleasure. I ‚Å§hope this conversation encourages further discussion and leads to solutions that prioritize the health ‚Å§and well-being of all Jujuy ‚Äãresidents.
Please ‚Å£note that this is a fictional ‚Äãinterview based on the provided information.

author: WCYB
title: chevron-right
text: WASHINGTON COUNTY, Tenn. (WCYB) ‚Äî An Erwin man accused of intentionally crashing a vehicle and punching a woman has been charged, according to the Washington County, Tennessee Sheriff's Office. Deputies arrested 37-year-old Brice Teague on Wednesday and charged him with aggravated domestic assault, evading arrest and driving on a suspended license. Deputies responded to a wreck in the 1100 block of Conklin Road. Once deputies arrived, the alleged victim was on scene but the driver, later identified as Teague, fled on foot. The alleged victim, who was a passenger in the car, said that that Teague intentionally crashed the vehicle and stated he said he ‚Äúwanted to kill her and himself.‚Äù Teague is accused of punched the woman multiple times in the arm, and she had bruising on her wrists, arms and shoulders. Teague was found a short time later in a field on Cloyd Road. He ran into the woods, and deputies found him hiding under a log. Teague is being held in the Washington County Detention Center on a $50,000 bond and is due in court on Thursday.

author: Luciana Caczan
title: Quase 5 mil pessoas foram presas desde janeiro no Equador
text:
Quase 5 mil pessoas foram presas desde janeiro no Equador
Governo de Daniel Noboa declarou conflito armado interno no pa√≠s em 9 de janeiro
O Governo do Equador deteve quase cinco mil pessoas desde 9 de janeiro, quando o presidente Daniel Noboa declarou um conflito armado no pa√≠s, segundo comunicado das autoridades.
O relat√≥rio detalha que apenas 237 dos detidos, ou seja, apenas 4,8% do total, s√£o acusados de terrorismo. As autoridades n√£o esclareceram se entre todos os presos est√£o Adolfo Mac√≠as, conhecido como ‚ÄúFito‚Äù, l√≠der da gangue Los Choneros ‚Äì o fugitivo mais procurado do pa√≠s ‚Äì ou Fabricio Col√≥n Pico, conhecido como ‚ÄúCapit√°n Pico‚Äù, l√≠der do criminoso grupo Los Lobos.
A CNN est√° tentando entrar em contato com a Secretaria-Geral de Comunica√ß√£o do Governo equatoriano para saber quantos dos detidos foram processados.
Por outro lado, Noboa solicitou apoio ao projeto de lei que enviou para discuss√£o no Congresso, que inclui modifica√ß√µes econ√¥micas que, segundo ele, s√£o necess√°rias para enfrentar o conflito armado interno.
‚ÄúEstamos em uma semana crucial, em que vamos decidir se vamos votar no Plano de Seguran√ßa ou n√£o financi√°-lo e ficar √† merc√™ de grupos narcoterroristas‚Äù, disse Noboa em um v√≠deo na sua conta X, anteriormente Twitter.
O projeto de lei proposto pelo presidente contempla, entre outras medidas, o aumento do Imposto sobre o Valor Acrescentado (IVA) para 15%, tr√™s pontos acima do m√°ximo atual, estabelecido em 12%. A iniciativa ser√° submetida para vota√ß√£o na Assembleia Nacional durante a pr√≥xima semana.

author: Mark Newman
title: Hundreds take plunge for Grimsby Polar Bear Dip
text: Cloudy skies, a windchill of ‚Äì3 C and a water temperature of 2.6 C ‚Äî perfect conditions to take a dip into Lake Ontario. If you are a polar bear that is. About 200 people of all ages jumped into the cold drink off [Bal Harbour Park](https://facilities.grimsby.ca/Home/Detail?CategoryIds=11218%2C11229&FacilityTypeIds=20447%2C20448&Keywords=&ScrollTo=google-map-trigger&CloseMap=true&Id=77f44db9-2aff-4d8b-a647-8711a4c30037) Jan. 1 in the 15th annual [Grimsby Polar Bear Dip](https://grimsbypolarbear.ca/). The event also attracted about 300 spectators. ‚ÄúIt was damn cold,‚Äù said Malcolm Harris after emerging from the water. It was his first polar bear plunge. ‚ÄúIt was exhilarating,‚Äù added Harris‚Äôs friend Joe Schweitzer, who also went into the frigid water for the first time. You might be interested in Most of the dippers ran in and out of the water while some stayed in for a few minutes. Swimmers began lining up to register for the 2 p.m. event an hour before splash time. Participants were asked to sign a waiver and organizers ran out of copies about 15 minutes before the dip began and people who didn‚Äôt sign the waiver were permitted to take part. Many brought along bundles of warm clothing to change into after emerging from the lake. Parking on the side streets near the beach area was almost impossible to find between 1:30 p.m. and 2:30 p.m. The event raised more than $8,700 for the [McNally House Hospice](https://www.mcnallyhousehospice.com/), $3,000 more than last year. Since it began, the dip has raised more than $43,000 for the hospice. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a great way to start the year doing something that is very cold and not fun but the community support that comes out is awesome,‚Äù said Allie Zanuk, a former event organizer who took part in her ninth swim. Event organizer and polar bear Gavin Lutz said this year's dip included about 60 more people than last year, the most ever. ‚ÄúGrimsby supports their community and it‚Äôs a great way to start the year,‚Äù Lutz said. ‚ÄúWe wash away the old year and we have some fun.‚Äù

author: diariopereira@pulzo-hermes.com
title: Papa Francisco, en misa de Jueves Santo, hizo llamado de atenci√≥n a sacerdotes
text: El Diario es un medio que brinda la m√°s completa informaci√≥n de lo que pasa en Risaralda y su capital Pereira, as√≠ como en Colombia y el mundo. [Visitar sitio](https://www.eldiario.com.co/) [En este Jueves Santo](https://www.pulzo.com/vivir-bien/jueves-santo-2023-que-se-conmemora-este-dia-cual-es-su-significado-PP2723577A#:~:text=Celebraci%C3%B3n%20del%20Jueves%20Santo&text=En%20algunos%20pa%C3%ADses%2C%20se%20llevan,y%20la%20condena%20de%20Jes%C3%BAs.), en el marco del inicio del Triduo Pascual de la Semana Santa, el Papa Francisco presidi√≥ la Misa Crismal en el Vaticano. Durante la ceremonia, el Sumo Pont√≠fice pronunci√≥ una larga homil√≠a, destacando la importancia de la humildad y el perd√≥n para los sacerdotes. (Le puede interesar: [Bicicleta que Egan Bernal le regal√≥ al papa Francisco es subastada y cuesta una fortuna](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/subastan-bicicleta-que-egan-bernal-regalo-papa-francisco-cuanto-vale-PP3522067)) En su mensaje, el [Papa Francisco](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/papa-francisco) inst√≥ a los cl√©rigos a liberarse de los ego√≠smos y las ambiciones que puedan obstaculizar su ministerio pastoral. ‚ÄúCu√°nto necesitamos liberarnos de resistencias y recriminaciones, de ego√≠smos y ambiciones, de rigorismos e insatisfacciones, para encomendarnos e interceder ante Dios, encontrando en √©l una paz que salva de cualquier tempestad‚Äù, expres√≥ el Santo Padre. [#Internacional]‚úùÔ∏è| El Papa Francisco en [#JuevesSanto]lava pies a reclusas mientras est√° en silla de ruedas. [#PapaFrancisco] [#SemanaSanta] üì∏ EFE [pic.twitter.com/nYDV2MOFvw] ‚Äî Moviendo Ideas (@moviendoideas) [March 28, 2024] Adem√°s, el Papa hizo un llamado a la compasi√≥n y la misericordia hacia aquellos que est√°n alejados de la fe. ‚ÄúA nosotros, sus Pastores, el Se√±or no nos pide juicios despectivos sobre los que no creen, sino amor y l√°grimas por los que est√°n alejados. Las situaciones dif√≠ciles que vemos y vivimos, la falta de fe, los sufrimientos que tocamos, al entrar en contacto con un coraz√≥n compungido, no suscitan la determinaci√≥n en la pol√©mica, sino la perseverancia en la misericordia‚Äù, expres√≥ el Papa Francisco. La Misa Crismal es una de las ceremonias m√°s significativas para la Iglesia Cat√≥lica durante la Semana Santa. En esta ocasi√≥n, se bendicen los √≥leos que se utilizar√°n en los sacramentos del bautismo, la confirmaci√≥n y la unci√≥n de los enfermos, y se renuevan las promesas sacerdotales. (Lea tambi√©n: [¬øDios es pereirano? Al papa Francisco le cay√≥ del cielo la camiseta del ‚ÄòMateca√±a‚Äô](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/papa-francisco-recibio-camiseta-pereira-vaticano-PP3511835)) El llamado [del Papa Francisco](https://www.pulzo.com/entretenimiento/papa-francisco-semana-santa-quien-es-trayectoria-curiosidades-PP3538883) a la humildad y al perd√≥n resuena en un momento en el que la Iglesia enfrenta desaf√≠os internos y externos. Sus palabras reflejan la importancia de mantenerse fieles a los valores del Evangelio y de servir con amor y compasi√≥n a todos los fieles, especialmente a aquellos que m√°s lo necesitan. Las im√°genes de la Misa Crismal, cedidas por el Vaticano, muestran al Papa Francisco presidiendo la ceremonia, acompa√±ado por cl√©rigos de todo el mundo. Estas im√°genes capturan la solemnidad y la reverencia del evento, as√≠ como la devoci√≥n del Santo Padre hacia su ministerio pastoral. En un mundo marcado por la divisi√≥n y el conflicto, las palabras del Papa Francisco resuenan como un llamado a la reconciliaci√≥n y la compasi√≥n. Que su mensaje inspire a todos los sacerdotes a seguir el ejemplo de humildad y servicio de Jesucristo, llevando la luz del Evangelio a todos los rincones del mundo. [Papa Francisco: historia de su trayectoria, su paso por Colombia y algunas curiosidades](/entretenimiento/papa-francisco-semana-santa-quien-es-trayectoria-curiosidades-PP3538883) [Papa Francisco or√≥ en misa del Domingo de Ramos por mujer y ni√±o asesinados en Antioquia](/mundo/papa-francisco-hizo-oracion-misa-mujer-nino-asesinados-antioquia-PP3534452A) [El pan colombiano que lleg√≥ al Vaticano y que atrae a los m√°s fieles](/economia/pan-con-fe-producto-colombiano-que-ya-llego-vaticano-PP3526322) [Bicicleta que Egan Bernal le regal√≥ al papa Francisco es subastada y cuesta una fortuna](/deportes/subastan-bicicleta-que-egan-bernal-regalo-papa-francisco-cuanto-vale-PP3522067) El Papa Francisco hizo hincapi√© en la importancia de comprender correctamente el significado de las l√°grimas de compunci√≥n, subrayando que no se trata simplemente de autocompasi√≥n o regodearse en las adversidades experimentadas. Explic√≥ que estas l√°grimas no surgen de un deseo de l√°stima hacia uno mismo ni de recrearse en las injusticias sufridas, sino que son un acto de profundo arrepentimiento por haber entristecido a Dios con el pecado. El Santo Padre advirti√≥ sobre la tristeza seg√∫n el mundo, que se regodea en las aflicciones y se autocompadece, contrast√°ndola con la tristeza seg√∫n Dios. Seg√∫n Francisco, tener l√°grimas de compunci√≥n implica reconocer humildemente nuestra condici√≥n de deudores ante Dios y admitir haber perdido el rumbo hacia la santidad al no confiar plenamente en el amor de Aquel que entreg√≥ su vida por nosotros. Posteriormente, el Papa enfatiz√≥ que un coraz√≥n sin arrepentimiento ni l√°grimas se vuelve progresivamente r√≠gido. En primer lugar, se aferra a sus rutinas; luego, se vuelve intolerante hacia los problemas y ajeno a las personas; despu√©s, se enfr√≠a y casi se vuelve insensible, como si estuviera envuelto en una coraza impenetrable; finalmente, se convierte en un coraz√≥n de piedra. No obstante, insisti√≥ en que ¬´as√≠ como una gota excava la piedra, las l√°grimas lentamente perforan los corazones endurecidos¬ª. De esta manera, se observa el milagro de la tristeza que conduce a la dulzura. ‚ÄúLa compunci√≥n es el remedio‚Äù, afirm√≥, ‚Äúpues nos revela la verdad sobre nosotros mismos, permitiendo que la profundidad de nuestra condici√≥n pecadora revele la realidad infinitamente mayor de ser perdonados‚Äù. LO √öLTIMO [Mundo] Hace 2 horas [Papa Francisco no fue tan pac√≠fico en mensaje de Jueves Santo; dio duro serm√≥n a sacerdotes](/mundo/papa-francisco-misa-jueves-santo-hizo-llamado-atencion-sacerdotes-PP3541415A) [Mundo] Hace 2 horas [Explican qu√© podr√≠a pasar con colombianos en Argentina tras pelea entre Petro y Milei](/mundo/colombia-argentina-que-pasara-con-colombianos-pelea-entre-petro-milei-PP3541556) [Mundo]

author: Reda√ß√£o
title: Lula: Brasil pode ter ind√∫stria da sa√∫de para competir com qualquer outro pa√≠s do mundo
text:
04/04/2024 - 18:04
O presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva disse nesta quinta-feira, 5, que o Brasil tem condi√ß√µes de ter uma ind√∫stria de sa√∫de competitiva e que o SUS seria fundamental para o desenvolvimento do setor. Ele deu a declara√ß√£o em Goiana (PE), em inaugura√ß√£o de f√°brica da Hemobr√°s.
‚ÄúQueremos um pa√≠s soberano, capaz de ter uma ind√∫stria da sa√∫de, porque n√≥s temos o √≥rg√£o consumidor que √© o SUS. Que pode comprar as m√°quinas que a gente produzir, os rem√©dios que a gente produzir, as vacinas. A gente n√£o tem por que n√£o acreditar que a gente pode ter um polo industrial na √°rea da sa√∫de para competir com qualquer outro pa√≠s do mundo‚Äù, declarou o presidente da Rep√∫blica.
Al√©m disso, Lula voltou a falar sobre intelig√™ncia artificial. Disse, dirigindo-se √† ministra da Ci√™ncia e Tecnologia, Luciana Santos, que quer ver um projeto brasileiro para o setor at√© junho. O petista afirmou ter dado a seguinte declara√ß√£o em uma reuni√£o com a ministra e cientistas: ‚ÄúVamos criar vergonha, vamos ter uma Confer√™ncia Nacional de Ci√™ncia e Tecnologia em junho, e at√© junho voc√™s est√£o desafiados a me apresentar um projeto brasileiro de intelig√™ncia artificial para a gente n√£o ter que copiar de outro pa√≠s as coisas importantes que n√≥s precisamos.‚Äù

author: PTI
title: PM Modi inaugurates NLC India's solar power plant in Rajasthan, marking a significant step towards renewable energy revolution | Law-Order
text: PM Modi inaugurates NLC India's solar power plant in Rajasthan, marking a significant step towards renewable energy revolution [PTI](/pti-stories)| New Delhi | Updated: 16-02-2024 16:29 IST | Created: 16-02-2024 16:27 IST - Country: - India Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday laid the foundation stone for NLC India Ltd's 300-mw solar power project in Barsingsar, Rajasthan. The prime minister also laid the found stone of other solar projects in the state. Addressing the event through videoconferencing, Modi said that the country has started moving at a fast pace in generating solar power, and in giving an impetus to this mission, today, the foundation stone has been laid for various solar power projects in Rajasthan. The projects, he said, will not only give green and cheap power to the region but also provide great employment opportunities to the youth. The total cost of NLC India's solar project is estimated at Rs 1,756 crore and it is scheduled to be commissioned in September, the public sector enterprise said in a statement. The project is strategically located near the existing Barsingsar Thermal Power Station which offers advantages in power evacuation through the existing network and utilisation of common infrastructure facilities. The company said that it has signed a power usage pact with Rajasthan Urja Vikas Nigam Ltd for the entire capacity of 300 mw at a tariff of Rs 2.52 per unit. NLC India is a navratna company under the coal ministry. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) title: La FRUTA que le DA JUVENTUD a tu piel | Tiene propiedades antioxidantes, repara los da√±os, hidrata y CONTROLA EL EXCESO DE GRASA - El Cronista
text:

Hidratarla adecuadamente es clave, ya que la piel tiende a volverse m√°s fina y menos el√°stica con la edad. Una alimentaci√≥n sana , rica en verduras y frutas, proporciona nutrientes esenciales para mantener la elasticidad y prevenir la sequedad .
Estos alimentos contienen antioxidantes que combaten los radicales libres , protegiendo la piel del da√±o causado por factores externos. Adem√°s, mantenerse bien hidratado internamente contribuye a una piel radiante .

La fruta que ayuda a tener la piel joven y bella Seg√∫n una publicaci√≥n de la revista Semana, la fruta que ayuda a reparar la piel por los da√±os del Sol y de paso es excelente para controlar la acumulaci√≥n de la grasa, es el maracuy√° .
Maracuy√° para la salud de la piel. Fuente: Freepik. El maracuy√° emerge como un aliado vital para la salud cut√°nea . Con abundantes vitaminas como la A y C, act√∫a como potente antioxidante, previniendo el envejecimiento y restaurando da√±os solares.
Su contenido de potasio, f√≥sforo y magnesio protege la piel facial, mientras que su riqueza en hierro favorece la formaci√≥n de hemoglobina. El art√≠culo destaca propiedades hidratantes y antiinflamatorias de esta fruta tropical. El maracuy√° tambi√©n controla el exceso de grasa en el cuerpo. Publicaciones avaladas por la Universidad Nacional de Colombia subrayan sus beneficios, demostrando una significativa reducci√≥n en c√©lulas cancer√≠genas , respaldando su papel en la prevenci√≥n y el cuidado de la piel.
Dos formas de aprovechar los beneficios del maracuy√° en tu piel Incorpora esta fruta √°cida en tu dieta o rutina de maquillaje.
Mascarilla. Fuente: Freepik. Para un mejor provecho, puedes usar la pulpa del maracuy√° y consumirla de forma directa o bien, agregarlo a un delicioso jugo en agua mineral.
Tambi√©n puedes usar la pulpa del maracuy√° como mascarilla . De manera sencilla, agrega a un maracuy√° dos cucharadas de miel, revuelve con movimientos envolventes y una vez est√© hecha la pasta, aplica durante unos 15 minutos en tu piel y remueve con abundante agua fr√≠a.

author: Dominic Robertson
title: Ambulance service worker who came out of retirement to help during pandemic is recognised with BEM
text:
Ambulance service worker who came out of retirement to help during pandemic is recognised with BEM
An ambulance service worker has been honoured for her services to the Community First Responder scheme in North Wales.
Linda Williams, from Wrexham, is one of three Welsh Ambulance Service workers recognised in the New Year Honours list.
Linda, a volunteer support administrator, receives the British Empire Medal.
She joined the service in 2004 and spent 11 years as an emergency medical technician before an injury meant she had to step back from her patient-facing role.
Linda, who is based in St Asaph, Denbighshire, now supports Community First Responders, the volunteers who attend 999 calls in their area and administer first aid in the precious first minutes before an ambulance arrives.
She put her retirement plans on hold in 2020 to support volunteers through the Covid-19 pandemic. Next year, she will celebrate 20 years of service.
She said: ‚ÄúWorking on the road gave me enormous satisfaction, especially when you saved somebody‚Äôs life.
‚ÄúNow I support volunteers, which means I still get to apply all of my clinical knowledge and can also give colleagues the benefit of my experience ‚Äì it‚Äôs a different kind of satisfaction.
‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs practical or emotional support, I‚Äôm here to help them in whatever way I can ‚Äì a lot of them call me ‚Äòmum'.
‚ÄúWhen a letter arrived from the Cabinet Office, I thought somebody was trying to sell me something.
‚ÄúThen it sank in, and I just started crying.
‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe that somebody out there thinks what I do is good enough to warrant a British Empire Medal.‚Äù
Other Wales Ambulance Service workers recognised include Wendy Herbert and Gerry Adams.
Wendy, the trust‚Äôs assistant director of quality and nursing, has been awarded the King‚Äôs Ambulance Service Medal (KAM) for distinguished service.
Community First Responder Gerry has been appointed a Member of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire (MBE) for voluntary services to the community in Barry.
The service's chief executive Jason Killens said: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre beyond thrilled that Wendy, Gerry and Linda have been recognised in the King‚Äôs New Year Honours List.
‚ÄúWendy‚Äôs commitment to the delivery of high-quality patient care knows no bounds, while Gerry and Linda‚Äôs contribution to volunteering goes above and beyond the call of duty.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre especially pleased that His Majesty has recognised not one, but two members of our volunteering family.
‚ÄúThese awards celebrate some of our very best ambulance professionals, and I‚Äôd like to extend a huge congratulations to Wendy, Gerry and Linda, of whom we are incredibly proud.‚Äù
Almost 500 Community First Responders give up their time to support the ambulance service in Wales, and last year, they attended more than 10,000 emergencies.
Jenny Wilson, the trust‚Äôs national volunteer manager, said: ‚ÄúVolunteering at the Welsh Ambulance Service has come a long way in the last two decades.
‚ÄúThe role that Community First Responders play in starting the chain of survival can mean the difference between life and death, while volunteer car service drivers are a really important cog in the wheel of the non-emergency service.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre delighted that Gerry and Linda‚Äôs contributions to volunteering are being recognised by His Majesty on the national stage.‚Äù
